q1_integration_approach.question: Use GitHub CLI (gh) or GitHub API?
q1_integration_approach.answer: Shell out to GitHub CLI (gh pr create)

q2_cli_surface_design.question: New 'create' command or flag on 'generate'?
q2_cli_surface_design.comment: when using standalone, it should be possible to point to a previously generated yaml and use that

q3_pr_data_source.question: Always generate first, or allow reuse of last generated PR data?
q3_pr_data_source.answer: Allow reuse of last generated PR data from session (with --use-last flag or similar)

q6_dry_run.question: Should 'prescribe create' support a dry-run/preview mode?
q6_dry_run.answer: Yes: Support --dry-run flag that shows what would be created

q7_error_handling.question: What should happen on failure?
q7_error_handling.answer: Exit with error + save generated PR data to file for manual retry

q8_title_body_override.question: Allow user override of generated title/body?
q8_title_body_override.answer: Yes: Support --title and --body flags to override generated content
q8_title_body_override.comment: We can allow the user to edit the generated yaml data in full.

summary.cli_surface: Both: generate --create and standalone create (with ability to point to previously generated YAML)
summary.data_source: Allow reuse of last generated PR data
summary.branch_handling: Push branch before creating PR, but don't create branch remotely. Base branch defaults to main (via --base flag default)
summary.draft_prs: Supported via --draft flag, but not default
summary.error_handling: Exit with error + save generated PR data to file for manual retry
summary.title_body_override: Supported via --title and --body flags, plus full YAML editing capability
